intro: Anisodus sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers with prominent, horn-like seed pods. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by the development of its distinctive seed pods. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
